trans-unit.source: thread-safe; the current thread must be same as the current thread affinity. In other words, this function can only "push" an object from the current thread to another thread, it cannot "pull" an object from any arbitrary thread to the current thread. There is one exception to this rule however: objects with no thread affinity can be "pulled" to the current thread.
trans-unit.target: 現在のスレッドは、現在のスレッドのアフィニティと同じでなければなりません。言い換えれば、この関数は現在のスレッドから別のスレッドにオブジェクトを "push "することしかできず、任意のスレッドから現在のスレッドにオブジェクトを "pull "することはできません。しかし、この規則には1つの例外があります:スレッドのアフィニティがないオブジェクトは、現在のスレッドに "pull "することができます。

trans-unit.source: to 150 results in all characters in the font being 1.5 times (ie. 150%) wider. The minimum stretch factor is 1, and the maximum stretch factor is 4000. The default stretch factor is AnyStretch, which will accept any stretch factor and not apply any transform on the font.

trans-unit.source: to call submitAll() depends on the table's edit strategy. The default strategy is QSqlTableModel::OnRowChange, which specifies that pending changes are applied to the database when the user selects a different row. Other strategies are QSqlTableModel::OnManualSubmit (where all changes are cached in the model until you call submitAll()) and QSqlTableModel::OnFieldChange (where no changes are cached). These are mostly useful when QSqlTableModel is used with a view.
